author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->
I went back and capitalized the repo name, added the .jl.git suffix to the repo name, and added a version in compat

If [this package was](https://github.com/aiqc/Refinery.jl/blob/085730fe6675dd08299abd916518916bfae57caf/README)

> Created for the purpose of testing the JuliaHub registry

and since the package is basically empty I would say the test was successful and this PR can be closed

Thanks for taking a look @giordano  

Do all packages have to go through manual review when initially being created? 
Does each subsequent version have to be manually reviewed?

Should I expect "Refinery" to appear in the registry?
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74990642/138607258-6247f88a-cb4e-4be6-b398-db74896968a7.png)

> Do all packages have to go through manual review when initially being created?

Pull requests for registering a new package are open for 3 days to let people have a look and raise objections, if necessary, like in this case.  After this period, if there are no blocking comments, the pull request is automatically merged.

> Does each subsequent version have to be manually reviewed?

In principle anyone can block also subsequent versions, but the time windows before the PR is automatically merged is 10 minutes for new versions.

> Should I expect "Refinery" to appear in the registry?

_After_ a pull request like this is merged, yes, before of that, no.
Seems like the test worked. However, the General registry is not a testing area, it is "production". So please be mindful of that in the future.
